p: Influenza outbreaks occur mainly during winter in temperate areas of the northern and southern hemispheres; however, influenza outbreaks in tropical areas around the equator may occur at any time of the year [ 1]. Influenza is not only responsible for local epidemics annually but also global pandemics. Since the 20 th century, there have been four flu pandemics: 1918 H1N1 Spanish flu [ 2], 1957 H2N2 Asian flu, 1968 H3N2 Hong Kong flu, and 2009 H1N1 swine flu. The 1918 H1N1 Spanish flu, which killed more than 50 million people worldwide, was the most severe pandemic [ 3].
